'''Minecraft: Volume 1''' is the first installment in a graphic novel series by [[Dark Horse Comics]].<ref>[https://www.darkhorse.com/Books/30-962/Minecraft-Volume-1-TPB ''Minecraft: Volume 1'' by SfÃ© R. Monster]</ref> The story introduces the cast of the series, showing [[Tyler]] and his [[The Gang|friends]] going on several quests after his life changes.

== Synopsis ==
{{Quote|The first graphic novel set in the world of the gaming phenomenon Minecraft!

[[Tyler]] is your everyday kid whose life is changed when his family has to move from the town he's always known. Thankfully, Tyler has a strong group of friends forever linked in the world of Minecraft! Tyler, along with his friends [[Evan]], [[Candace]], [[Tobi]], and [[Grace]], have been going on countless adventures together across the expanses of the [[Overworld]] and are in need of a new challenge. The group decides to go on the Ultimate Quest--to travel to [[the End]] and face off against the [[ender dragon]]!|Book description}}

== Quotes ==
{{Quote|The most exciting part as a queer person, and a nonbinary person working in the environment of Minecraft, the people who were supporting the comic, who wanted it to exist want to include diversity, we want to show that its not just binary kids playing, white kids playing, we get to show the full spectrum of identity playing in this game, literally limitless, you can be and do anything which is so exciting to see taking shape in comics, especially in Minecraft.

It was wild to me, because coming up in the industry was a very binary game, the editors that we're working with, when they pitched it were like we want to make sure diversity is at the forefront of Minecraft and that's one of the keystones of the platform

Infinite diversity means you can model and reshape the world, and the friendships that you're building are constantly modelling and reshaping and your identities can transition within the game, the game can accommodate that, make a space to explore yourself and figure out who you are and what you are and how you fit into the world.|[[SfÃ© Monster]]<ref>{{Citation|url=https://bleedingcool.com/comics/sarah-graley-sfe-monster-non-binary-appeal-minecraft-comic/|title=Sarah Graley and SfÃ© Monster on the Non-Binary Appeal of a Minecraft Comic at ECCC|author=[https://bleedingcool.com/author/rich-johnston/ Rich Johnston]|website=Bleeding Cool|date=March 16, 2019}}</ref>}}

=== Awards ===
In 2020, the comic was nominated for the 2019 Diamond Gem Awards, in the category of Best All Ages Original/Reprint GN.<ref>{{Citation|url=https://bleedingcool.com/comics/once-future-and-spawn-top-diamond-gem-award-2019-winners/|title=Once & Future and Spawn Top Diamond Gem Award 2019 Winners|author=[https://bleedingcool.com/author/rich-johnston/ Rich Johnston]|website=Bleeding Cool|date=March 27, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|url=https://bleedingcool.com/comics/nominees-announced-diamond-2019-gem-awards/|title=Nominees Announced For Diamond's 2019 Gem Awards|author=[https://bleedingcool.com/author/rich-johnston/ Rich Johnston]|website=Bleeding Cool|date=March 12, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.sarahgraley.com/minecraft|title=Minecraft Volume 1 (Dark Horse Comics)|website=Sarah Graley}}</ref>

== Trivia ==

* The cover for the comic was used on the 4 day passes for {{Wikipedia|Emerald City Comic Con}} 2019.<ref>{{Tweet|sarahgraleyart|1106758956318420993|Also: extremely stoked about the Minecraft cover (for the book me and @sfemonster made, out in July!) being on the 4 day passes! ðŸ˜±ðŸ’–ðŸ’–ðŸ’–}}</ref>
* The book's unique art style, noticeably more round than typical iterations, was partly requested by the editors. Illustrator [[Sarah Graley]] struggled with the task, calling out the [[ender dragon]]'s design, but was satisfied with the finished result.<ref>{{Mcnet|new-graphic-novel|New Graphic Novel|May 25, 2019|[[Tom Stone]]}}</ref>

=== Errors ===

* [[Tyler]] at one point throws an [[ender pearl]] to reach a destination, drawn identical to an [[eye of ender]].
* [[Candace]] at one point is said to have set off a [[creeper]], destroying a [[nether portal]] that Grace ended up replacing. This is impossible, since [[obsidian]] was designed specifically to be resistant to [[explosions]].
* During the first scene in the [[Hibiscus House]], three [[chests]] can be seen next to each other. Although the frames are noticeable, they lack borders, making it appear as one long chest divided into three sections, one resembling a double chest.
